posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: good morning! my FRC team is having problems simulating the robot code with “simulate code” on our VS code. A warning always appears: "Warning at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:433): The robot program quit unexpectedly. This is usually due to a code error." The above stacktrace can help determine where the error occurred. See [Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation](https://wpilib.org/stacktrace) for more information. Another error at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:440): "The startCompetition() method (or methods called by it) should have handled the exception above." What can be done? Sorry for my English; I’m Brazilian.

link_counts.title: Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: You need to scroll up in the output window to see the specific error that is causing your code to crash.

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: The robot program encountered an error during initialization. The error occurred when attempting to load a specific class related to the SwerveModuleSimulationConfig. The detailed stack trace indicates that the error originated from the SwerveDrive class during the creation of a SwerveDrive object, which led to the failure of the SwerveSubsystem and ultimately caused the robot program to terminate unexpectedly. The issue appears to be related to missing dependencies or misconfigured paths, particularly concerning the HALSIM extensions and associated libraries. Additionally, there were warnings about potential issues with the CAN bus communication, suggesting possible wiring problems or insufficient power supply. The system then shut down cleanly after encountering these errors.

link_counts.title: Reading Stacktraces — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Looks like you don’t have the MapleSim vendordep installed. It should be available in the WPILib sidebar.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Please post the output of WPILib: Open Project Information.

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: WPILib Information: Project Version: 2025.1.1; VS Code Version: 1.96.2; WPILib Extension Version: 2025.1.1; C++ Extension Version: 1.23.6; Java Extension Version: 1.39.0; Java Debug Extension Version: 0.58.1; Java Dependencies Extension Version: 0.24.1; Java Version: 17; Java Location: C:\Users\Public\wpilib\2025\jdk. Vendor Libraries: AdvantageKit (4.1.2); DogLog (2025.0.0); maplesim (0.2.5); PathplannerLib (2025.1.1); CTRE-Phoenix (v5) (5.35.1); CTRE-Phoenix (v6) (25.1.0); photonlib (v2025.0.0-beta-8); ReduxLib (2025.0.0); REVLib (2025.0.0); Studica (2025.0.0); ThriftyLib (2025.0.1); URCL (2025.0.0-beta-1); WPILib-New-Commands (1.0.0); YAGSL (2025.1.3). Note: CTRE stands for Cross The Road Electronics and YAGSL stands for Yet Another Generic Swerve Library.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: Can you post the contents of .wpilib\wpilib_preferences.json?

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: Enable C++ Intellisense is set to false. Current language is Java. Project year is 2025beta. Team number is 9485. This is all the provided data.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: The text is: Somehow, you’re using a 2025 version of WPILib with a beta project that hasn’t been imported. VS Code should be prompting you to import your project every time you open it. Because of this, the vendor dependency manager is showing you beta versions of vendor dependencies, and you have mismatched versions. For example, the version of Advantage Kit you have needs WPILib 2025.3.2, but you’re using 2025.1.1, and most of the other vendordeps need beta versions of wpilib. You need to import your project and update all your vendordeps to compatible versions.

link_counts.title: Importing Last Year’s Robot Code — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Murilo Miranda Santos
posts.cooked: I tried doing this in the 2025 competition, but the drive station would always say "no robot code." Now that I am at home, the simulation works correctly, but when I try it with my physical robot, I have questions about whether errors will appear. Do you know what I can do to eliminate this error? Again, I apologize for my English; I'm Brazilian.
